documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_0: Including documents helps your local Public Health Unit confirm the immunization records you have provided. If you have documents you would like to include with your immunization information, click on the “Choose File” button below to add up to two documents.

documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_1: A document from your doctor displaying immunizations only. This can be a photo of the document.
documentCapture.INSTRUCTIONS_2: Any document that does not relate to immunization information.
documentCapture.UPLOAD_NOTES: These documents will only be used by your local Public Health Unit to confirm the immunization records you have provided. These files will not be added to the Provincial Immunization Resposity.
documentCapture.FILE_TYPES: Files must each be less than 5MB in size, and of the following file types: doc, docx, jpeg, jpg, pdf, png.

$pushTransactionTokenTimeout.TITLE: Session About to Expire
$pushTransactionTokenTimeout.BODY:
Your current session will expire shortly and any data you have entered will be discarded.

You can extend your session if you need more time.
$pushTransactionTokenTimeout.BUTTON_AFTERTHOUGHT: Cancelling will discard all your data.

$invalidDateError.TITLE: Invalid Immunization Dates
$invalidDateError.BODY: The date of immunizations cannot be before the patient's date of birth. Please review the immunization dates and the patient's date of birth.

$infoOiidHint.TITLE: Where can I find the Ontario Immunization ID?
$infoOiidHint.BODY: A patient's Ontario Immunization ID may be found on a letter sent from {{ phuName }}. If you do not have this code please contact {{ phuName }} at .

$infoLearnMoreAboutOiid.TITLE: What are the Ontario Immunization ID and PIN?
$infoLearnMoreAboutOiid.BODY:
An Ontario Immunization ID is a ten digit number that uniquely identifies each person in the provincial immunization repository.

A patient's PIN is a six digit number that protects the confidentiality of immunization information.

Where can I find them?

Your Ontario Immunization ID may be found on a letter sent from {{ phuName }}. If you do not have this code from your Health Unit, please contact {{ phuName }} at .

$infoOiidPinOutdated.TITLE: System Updated - Additional Info Required
$infoOiidPinOutdated.BODY: We are improving the site and have updated our authentication system. You are required to verify the patient, update the PIN and provide an email address.

$infoCallPhuGeneric.TITLE: Please Contact {{ phuName }}
$infoCallPhuGeneric.BODY: Sorry, we are unable to access the immunization record. Please contact {{ phuName }} at .

$infoOiidResourceNotFound.TITLE: Access Warning
$infoOiidResourceNotFound.BODY: The info that you have provided does not match our records. Please confirm the info and try again. After too many failed attempts, this Ontario Immunization ID will be locked.

$infoPatientDataCleared.BODY: Your personal health information has been cleared from this browser. You can now close your browser.

$infoSessionExpired.TITLE: Session Expired
$infoSessionExpired.BODY: Your session has expired and the data you entered has been discarded.

$warnStatusTooManyFailedAttempts.TITLE: Access Warning
$warnStatusTooManyFailedAttempts.BODY: Either the Ontario Immunization ID or PIN you have provided is incorrect. Please confirm this information and try again. After 10 failed attempts, this Ontario Immunization ID will be locked.

$warnGeneralServerError.TITLE: Server Error

welcomeAuthSubmitterModal.IMMUNIZATION_AUTH_SUBMISSION_LABEL: Who are you entering an Ontario Immunization ID and PIN for?

welcomeLandingPage.PHU_MESSAGE: Use this site to view and update your immunization record.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_UL: Why should I use this site?
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_1: It's an online alternative to paper immunization records.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_2: It allows Ontarians to securely keep track of their families' immunization records.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_3: It allows families to report their child's immunization records to their local public health unit, as required by the
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_BULLET_2: Child Care and Early Years Act, 2014 (CCEYA).
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_4: Public health units review immunization records to ensure school children are up to date with their immunizations.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_LI_5: Reporting immunizations helps to keep everyone protected from serious diseases that can be easily spread in schools and throughout our communities.
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_3: You may also need your immunization record for:
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_4: How do I use this site?
welcomeLandingPage.INTRO_5: Every time you or your child gets a vaccine, report it here so that you have a complete record of  your immunizations and they are submitted to your local Public Health unit.
welcomeLandingPage.SCHEDULE_RATIONALE: Protection against the diseases in italics is required for school attendance under the Immunization School Pupils Act. NOTE**Children born on or after January 1, 2010 also need to be immunized against Varicella.

welcomeAuthActions.AUTH_ACTION_TITLE: Verify Patient's ID to View Immunizations
welcomeAuthActions.AUTH_ACTION_OIID_HINT: <button class='icon-btn-link' id='home-oiid-link-two' ng-click='$ctrl.openHelpModal()'>Learn more</button> about what the Ontario Immunization ID and PIN are and where they can be found.

welcomeAnonActions.ANON_ACTION_TITLE: Don't have an Ontario Immunization ID and PIN?
welcomeAnonActions.ANON_ACTION_PARA: You can submit immunizations without an Ontario Immunization ID and PIN but you will be required to enter additional information along with the dates and names of vaccines given.
welcomeAnonActions.ANON_ACTION_OIID_HINT: <button class='icon-btn-link' id='home-oiid-link-one' ng-click='$ctrl.openHelpModal()'>Learn more</button> about what the Ontario Immunization ID and PIN are and where they can be found.

welcomeLogin.VIEW_BUTTON_PARA: You can view current, overdue and upcoming immunizations e.g. Like your Yellow Card, only better.
welcomeLogin.SUBMIT_BUTTON_PARA: Keep track of immunizations by reporting them to your Public Health Unit.
welcomeLogin.ANON_LABEL: Don't have an Ontario Immunization ID and PIN?
welcomeLogin.ANON_MESSAGE_1: You can submit immunizations without an
welcomeLogin.ANON_MESSAGE_2: but you will be required to enter additional information along with the dates and names of vaccines given.

yellowCardDisplay.TABLE_CAPTION: Table that categorizes Immunizations. Navigate on rows to choose the Date, then on column headings to find the Immunizations and their status.

yellowCardRecommendations.HEADING: Immunizations Needed
yellowCardRecommendations.INTRO: As recommended by the Ontario Immunization Schedule you need immunizations to be protected against the following diseases:
yellowCardRecommendations.NOTE: Note: Immunizations needed may change if additional immunization information is submitted.
yellowCardRecommendations.FOR_MORE_INFO: For more information please visit Ontario's Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care Immunization page.
yellowCardRecommendations.PRINT_BUTTON: Printable PDF Version of Immunization Record
yellowCardRecommendations.YC_CAVEAT: The information in the record above comes from the Ontario Immunization Repository.
